title: ICE when `cargo doc` on `lexical-core`: attempted .def_id() on invalid res: Err

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
<short summary of the bug>

I tried this code: Running `cargo doc` on a project that has `lexical-core 0.6.2` as its direct or indirect dependency.

I expected to see this happen: All packages documented.

Instead, this happened: `error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/hir/def.rs:345: attempted .def_id() on invalid res: Err` — also fails on `docs.rs`.

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.39.0-nightly (1dd188489 2019-09-22)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1dd1884891636d0eb51157d137230076bcf20627
commit-date: 2019-09-22
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.39.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```
Does also happen for older nightlies, though I forgot to capture the versions before updating in hope it'd fix the issue. There are more ICE issues pointing at `def.rs`, but none on this line here.

Backtrace:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:643:9
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.37/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88

             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.37/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:76

             at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1412

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:196

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:210

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:473

error: aborting due to previous error
```
